page.title: 07EMPLOYMENT
page.content: A SURVEY OF PARENTS OF ABOUT 100 CHILDREN FROM THE SCHOOL WAS CARRIED OUT. THE MAJORITY TRAVEL OUT OF SOMERSHAM TO WORK: 5 AS FAR AS LONDON, I5 TO CAMBRIDGE, AND THE MAJORITY TO THE INDUSTRIAL ESTATES OF NEARBY ST.IVES AND HUNTINGDON. ABOUT A FIFTH STAYED IN SOMERSHAM TO WORK; EITHER AT THE LOCAL SMALL MANUFACTURING AND LIGHT ENGEERING WORKS,FRUIT PACKAGING AND DISTRIBUTION FIRMS AND THE SHOPS. A FEW MEN INVOLVED IN BUILDING, ROOFING, CARPENTRY, FARMING AND RETAILING IN SOMERSHAM ARE SELF- EMPLOYED. ONLY 3 ARE UNEMPLOYED. ABOUT HALF OF THE MOTHERS DO NOT GO OUT TO WORK AND OF THOSE THAT DO THE MAJORITY DO CASUAL WORK SUCH AS FRUIT-PICKING OR PART-TIME WORK SUCH AS CLEANING, HELPING AT THE PLAY SCHOOLS OR IN SHOPS AT SOMERSHAM;VERY FEW WENT OUT OF SOMERSHAM TO WORK.
